alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 09 at 3:44PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Lake and northwestern Volusia Counties through 430 PM EST... At 344 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Crescent City to 7 miles north of Paisley. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daytona Beach, Ormond Beach, Holly Hill, Pierson and Ormond-By-the-Sea. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County
